meanings.definition: To betray someone's trust by secretly harming or plotting against them.
meanings.sent1: She decided to backstab her friend by spreading rumors behind her back.
meanings.sent2: He felt hurt when he found out his colleague tried to backstab him for a promotion.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky fox tried to backstab the clever rabbit in the race.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected twist in the story was when the hero's loyal companion attempted to backstab him.
meanings.sent5: The villain's plan to backstab the king was foiled by the brave knight.

meanings.definition: A treacherous or deceitful act of betrayal against someone.
meanings.sent1: The ultimate backstab was when she revealed all his secrets to their enemies.
meanings.sent2: The group was shocked by the sudden backstab that led to their downfall.
meanings.sent3: The backstab in the movie was so unexpected that the audience gasped in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The political backstab in the election campaign changed the course of history.
meanings.sent5: The backstab in the play added a thrilling twist to the plot.
